passage.text: Alteration in expression of the rat mitochondrial ATPase 6 gene during Pneumocystis carinii infection
Over-expression of the ATPase 6 gene occurs in type II pneumocytes and Clara cells during infection with P. carinii.

During the last few years, it became increasingly common for bacteria to have two-component systems that were thought to function as independent pathways. However, recent research by Posas et al. has shown that these systems are more than just components of a single enzyme; in fact, most of the time they serve as both forms of signalling and reversal mechanisms.
An altered IL-6 gene results in platelet count changes in healthy volunteers without inflammation. The question of whether this polymorphism affects reactive thrombocytosis is still unanswered.
